name: Hillview Cottage

reviews.title: Substandard and disappointing
reviews.text: Scotland is a beautiful country, it is unfortunate that we chose this as our accomodation. I was fooled by the well presented website. Based on our conversation with a local restaurant owner this is not uncommon, she hears many complaints. The breakfast was sparse and low quality (instant coffee and no tea, etc) The room and bathroom were both shabby (dirty carpet, thread bare worn linens, etc.) There is a highway with loud cars and trucks traveling at high speeds all night right next to the house. He charges 5% on credit card transactions with no advance warning. It was very evident in presentation and personality that the owner is doing this for cashflow only - total disregard to the rest.

We were taken with the picturesque setting and exterior of the restored home on the Internet. Also there were claims made on the website about home made bread, which we never saw in 6 nights. Unfortunately, the reality was not exactly the same as pictured.
reviews.title: Could Be Better
Stirling was the best!!
reviews.text: Breakfasts were served during a narrow window and you can’t be late. One in our party requested the eggs to be scrambled instead of fried and she was discouraged. The juice glasses were minute in order to discourage consumption. The coffee and tea were self-serve and the coffee was instant. The toast was generally cold. However, the eggs were fresh from chickens in the back yard.

reviews.title: my family voted this their favourite on the trip
reviews.text: There was not enough seating space in the main area when most of the rooms were taken. Our party was forced to eat in the hall way area just outside the kitchen. Part of the bed and breakfast experience is to talk with the other guests who are often quite interesting. On a number of occasions we were denied that opportunity.

reviews.title: Great B&B
reviews.text: The shower in the bath was inoperable for a few days. John happened to commence repairs while we were still in the room in the early evening.
this was exactly what we were looking for:
reviews.title: a taste of real scotland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a country cottage that gave us an authentic taste of everyday scotland, but still very clean and very comfortable.
reviews.title: Thank you Jon Darby at Hillview Cottage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the authentic, hot scottish breakfast was fantastic and the host was most accomodating in both picking us up and delivering us back to the train station.
reviews.title: LIke coming home

likes.disliked: — Small parking lot and blind driveway access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We cannot thank you enough for going out of your way to make out stay in Scotland, and especially your bnb, a wonderful memorable experience. We appreciate all you did for us, really explaining directions for outings etc., we had a wonderful time in Scotland, you people are generous with your time and efforts and as first time travellers from Australia we really appreciate everything you did for us. Thanks again, Mick and June from Australia
reviews.title: Worst B&B we have ever stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Scotland for the first time for a 2 week trip around the country. Our first stop for the night, after arriving at Edinburgh airport, was Stirling and the Hillview Cottage B&B. We had found it on Travelocity and booked it before departing the States. It was a lovely restful friendly place. The views from our room (we had the twin ensuite facing the pastures and woods) was serene and felt like a true home stay rather than a place of business. Jon the owner was so very friendly and kind and helpful. His full cooked breakfast was excellent and more than I could eat! The shower had tons of hot water at good pressure and the beds were very comfortable. We went from there to many other B&Bs as we traveled around the country and when we were on our way back to Edinburgh we decided to call Jon to see if he had a room available for us. He did and, after our travels, it was like coming home. We stayed in B&Bs that were more luxurious and more expensive but NONE of them had the charm, the comfort, and the fabulous hot showers and comfy beds of Hillview Cottage. Jon even made our dinner reservations at a very popular pub in Thornhill. We highly recommend a stay there if you're in the Stirling area.
reviews.title: no to Hillview Cottage

likes.liked: — after talking w/proprietor decided place was not for us

reviews.text: What a sad misrepresentation of the facts. The photos of this acconmmodation posted on the internet do not reflect the state of the place when you arrive. Firstly, the site is situated next to what seems like the long straight at Brands Hatch. However, that can be overlooked when you see the excellent views surrounding most of the property. Car parking was a nightmare. We were instructed by the son to park at an angle of 5 degrees in order to facilitate maximum use of the parking area, but there is not sufficient room for the number of cars, and it is extremely likely that once you have parked later in the day, you will not be able to move again until the following day. We were put in a room with one comfortable double bed and two bunk beds. There was no wardrobe, the one window was a completely sealed unit, the wall heater socket was hanging from the wall, we had to clean out the draws in the chest of draws before we could put any clothes in there, there were no fire escape notices, and the bathroom door was upside down! The room was built onto the end of the lounge where the children were doing their homework, on what turned out to be the breakfast table. The door which separated the room from the lounge was bare wood and did not fit the doorway properly. As such, we could not only hear them, but we could see the light which they kept on until they had finished their work. It was only possible to get any air in the room if we kept the back door open (which led to the rear of the property). This of course is completely impractical at night. As soon as we entered the property, it became obvious that there was a very strong smell of burning incense and personal items littered the entrance area. Breakfast was sub-standard, very little of it and cold. There is a false floor being constructed immediately above the dining table, which currently houses a pile of mattresses. There were also loose wires hanging from the ceiling. In summary, it was dirty, smelly, uncomfortable and littered with health and safety hazards. It is clearly simply a money making exercise and is not run with the care and consideration which, not unreasonably, one would expect. We left after the first night, having told the owner that we felt uncomfortable and unsafe.
reviews.title: Substandard and unsafe.
Nice B&B, good hospitality , but a bit hard to find and park
reviews.text: Took a while to find the B&B, went up and down different roads to find it. After wasting lots of petrol, rang the owner and he gave us directions. The B&B had parking, but was very tight when it came to others coming and going, it was not spacious.
The breakfast was lovely. So was the room.
reviews.title: Great B&B

reviews.text: It was close to all the places to visit in Stirling.
reviews.title: Great value, relaxed host

reviews.text: So, downside was poor parking, could do with a sign on the main road stating way to Hillivew.
reviews.title: We loved Hillview Cottage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this B&B for only one night between Edinburgh and Loch Ness, and we would definitely return. We booked the B&B online and were allocated the family room for the our stay which was very big and comfy. En suite bathroom was very clean and we had a flat screen TV with Freeview channels which is just what we wanted after a busy city break.
reviews.title: Fantastic B&B

reviews.text: We had a very warm welcome upon arrival and a recommendation to a great pub for dinner - The Lion & Unicorn near Thornhill. The B&B is only a short drive from Stirling Castle so is in a good location. Breakfast was included and was not only excellent but plentiful. Plus, our stay was only £60 for the night so was excellent value for money. We would definitely return to this B&B, hopefully for a longer stay next time.
reviews.title: pleasant memories
Loved the Ambience
reviews.text: One of our boys was just reminiscing about all the different places we visited and stayed at while we were in the UK. His favorite place out of all the places we stayed in Scotland was your bed and breakfast. : )

reviews.title: Nice stay at Hillview
reviews.text: Just thought it might encourage you to know that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thank you for the warm and friendly atmosphere
reviews.title: Thanks Jon

likes.liked: — It was clean, with plenty of comforts and good service.

description: Luxury B&B in an exclusive rural location close to Stirling Castle, Wallace Monument, Loch Lomond and Trossachs. Edinburgh and Glasgow a short drive away. Great hill views with all rooms ensuite. Warm and welcoming log fires, with a vaulted lounge. Internet access available! Excellent service tailored to individual needs
